content.description: Nice climbing with a crux up high (perhaps a tad sporty getting to the chains).  Probably the best route on the wall.
content.location:
2nd route from the left, shares anchor with

Lichen It

.

content.description: A nice route with good rock but short.  Tough to figure out/find holds.  Be careful clipping the 3rd bolt.
content.location:
First route on the left, just right of the chimney.  Shares anchor with

Steep and Cheap

.

content.description: Decent route with a couple tricky spots.

climbs.name: Forest Fire
climbs.fa: Lance Schultz, Steve & Jack Reed, Bryan Beavers

content.description: Rock quality not the best but what the hell.  Tricky pulling over the little roof at the start.  Put up during the Picnic Rock fire.
content.location:
5th route from the left, climbs through the little roof at the bottom right side of the wall.  Shares anchor with

Breaking Trail

.

climbs.name: Choss Mojination
climbs.fa: Bryan Beavers, Steve & Jack Reed, Lance Schultz

content.description: Classic Poudre choss - not for rock snobs.  The rock quality and climbing improves at the 4th bolt once the prow is reached.  The bottom section needs more cleaning to say the least.
content.location:
6th route from the left.  Actually starts on the south facing toe of the buttress.  There is a belay bolt at the bottom which can be used for both this route and

Forest Fire

.  Shares anchor with

Breaking Trail

and

Forest Fire

.

climbs.name: Breaking Trail
climbs.fa: Lance Schultz, Steve & Jack Reed, Bryan Beavers

content.description: Easiest route on the wall and worth doing if you're up there.  The name comes from the state of the trail to the Red Wall after we cleaned this route and sent huge blocks all the way down to the creek (don't worry, no one else was there).  One of the nice wood steps was destroyed (which were all later removed by the Forest Service anyway).
content.location: 4th route from the left, shares anchor with Forest Fire
